content:
I'm curious if anyone thinks porting the WordPress Migrate module would be at all useful: https://www.drupal.org/project/wordpress_migrate
I know there's Feeds and https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/wordpress_import but I think both of those only handle basic WordPress sites, and not something with more complexity.

backdrop-contrib/wordpress_import
This module imports a WordPress blog into Backdrop from a WordPress eXtended RSS (WXR) file. - backdrop-contrib/wordpress_import
wordpress_migrate has a dependency on migrate so we'd need to fix up backdrop-contrib/migrate before doing wordpress_migrate; I'm not saying don't do it just pointing out some of the ducks.

Yes, I am aware that there is a bigger task as a dependency, which is why I'm asking, rather than just doing it. :slight_smile:
I've been working on a project that is a migration from WordPress to D7, and in the process I'm fixing some problems with the migrate modules. I intend to provide those fixes to the D7 modules, but I thought they might be more used/useful for Backdrop.
